meanings.sent1: She labored to finish her homework before bedtime.
meanings.sent2: He walked laboredly up the steep hill.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel labored to carry the oversized acorn up the tree.
meanings.sent4: The old car labored up the hill, struggling with each turn of the wheel.
meanings.sent5: The ant labored tirelessly to move the large crumb to its nest.

meanings.definition: Showing signs of effort or strain
meanings.sent1: Her labored breathing indicated she had been running for a while.
meanings.sent2: The labored expression on his face revealed his discomfort.
meanings.sent3: The cat's labored attempt to catch the laser pointer amused the children.
meanings.sent4: The labored engine of the old truck sputtered to life.
meanings.sent5: The labored movements of the injured bird touched the hearts of onlookers.

meanings.definition: To work hard or with difficulty
meanings.sent1: They labored all day in the fields to harvest the crops.
meanings.sent2: She labored over her painting, adding intricate details.
meanings.sent3: The chef labored in the kitchen to create a masterpiece for the guests.
meanings.sent4: The workers labored to build the bridge before the deadline.
meanings.sent5: He labored through the night to finish the project on time.
